meanings.definition: The measurement of the intensity and wavelength of fluorescence emitted by a substance when exposed to light of a specific wavelength.
meanings.sent1: In spectrofluorometry, scientists study how substances glow when light shines on them.
meanings.sent2: Researchers used spectrofluorometry to examine the brightness and color of the substance's glow.
meanings.sent3: During the experiment, the spectrofluorometry machine made the lab look like a colorful disco party.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of spectrofluorometry lies in revealing the hidden colors of substances under light.
meanings.sent5: The classroom demonstration of spectrofluorometry left the students in awe of the glowing liquids.

meanings.definition: The technique used to analyze the fluorescence properties of a sample by measuring its emission spectrum.
meanings.sent1: Using spectrofluorometry, scientists can understand how samples emit light of different colors.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician performed spectrofluorometry to determine the unique light signature of the sample.
meanings.sent3: The spectrofluorometry analysis revealed that the sample's glow was brighter than expected.
meanings.sent4: In the world of science, spectrofluorometry acts as a powerful flashlight to reveal hidden properties.
meanings.sent5: The precision of spectrofluorometry allowed researchers to pinpoint the exact colors emitted by the sample.
